ratings.comment: Dr. Mahoney is a great lady. She had a big lecture but took the time to get to know everyone and met with them in small groups. The quizzes are easy and you can get an A without even reading the books. No final, plenty of extra credit opportunities, and open book quizzes. Defiantly a good class to take!

Prof Mahoney is a very sweet person who genuinely wants all of her students to do well. It's probably next to impossible to fail this class. Lots of extra credit options available. I loved every assigned reading (all novels), but you can probably skate by without reading them. Overall, an easy A.

Extremely easy class and Professor Mahoney really wants everyone to do well. She provides many different extra credit options and there is no reason you should not get an A. The material is interesting and you do not need to read the book very thoroughly in order to get a good grade. She is a sweet professor that is willing to help at any time.

Super easy class! She gives alot of extra credit. Don't read the readings for the second midterm it is the same as lecture. Let us use a whole sheet of paper on the final. If you need an easy class take this!

very nice,caring,and understading lady.However she assigns way too much reading.the class is boring and pointless, i still can't gather what i even learned.she is very unorganized and EXTREMELY slow at grading things.its an easy A but very annoying class overall.

Class is extremely easy, but very boring. Does not require a lot of effort, Read the assigned books;they are actually very interesting. She was very slow on posting grades, but she is very nice and helpful. Again, superrrrr easy!

She is a very nice prof, and I would take this class again.  It is an easy class if you go to lecture and take good notes (that means in addition to what she puts online).  I had contact with her via email and her responses were prompt, friendly, and very helpful.  I found the second half of the course to be less interesting than the first.

This class was a complete waste of time.  The lectures were painfully boring; all powerpoint and posted online.  Don't waste your time going to class.  The book and reader were never used.  You would have to try hard to not get an A.

The first half of the class was very fun and interesting, but the second half dragged on and she didn't seem as passionate about teaching. She's pretty straightforward about her expectations, offers extra credit, and allows a notecard for the final.

The professor is nice and creates a clear powerpoint presentation. The movies she shows in class are very interesting and most of the speakers in her class bring a personal touch to learning about drug abuse and treatment. Her tests are really easy as long as you attend lecture and read the summaries in the textbook.
